lineFollowerSim

Class LapTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lineFollowerSim.LapTimer

  • public class LapTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    LapTimer provides stopwatch and lap timer support for LFS.
    Author:
    Ron Grant

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int backgroundColor
      lap timer pane background color, default dark blue
      int frameColor
      lap timer window border color, default light blue
      int lapCount
      Current lap count
      int lapCountMax
      Maximum number of laps before robot forced to stop.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lapList
      ArrayList of lap times in String format "Lap X mn:se.msc" X=lap, mn = minutes, se = seconds, msc = milliseconds 0 to 999.
      float lapLookForEndDist
      Distance when lap detector starts searching for minimum distance.
      boolean lapTimerModeEnabled 
      boolean showStartTime
      Set true to include lap start time in lapTimer panel display.
      int textColor
      lap timer text color, default off-white rgb (240,240,240).

    • Field Detail

      • lapList

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> lapList
        ArrayList of lap times in String format "Lap X mn:se.msc" X=lap, mn = minutes, se = seconds, msc = milliseconds 0 to 999.

      • backgroundColor

        public int backgroundColor
        lap timer pane background color, default dark blue

      • frameColor

        public int frameColor
        lap timer window border color, default light blue

      • textColor

        public int textColor
        lap timer text color, default off-white rgb (240,240,240).

      • showStartTime

        public boolean showStartTime
        Set true to include lap start time in lapTimer panel display. Increases window width by about 90 pixels.

      • lapTimerModeEnabled

        public boolean lapTimerModeEnabled

      • lapCountMax

        public int lapCountMax
        Maximum number of laps before robot forced to stop.

      • lapCount

        public int lapCount
        Current lap count

      • lapLookForEndDist

        public float lapLookForEndDist
        Distance when lap detector starts searching for minimum distance. As soon as distance starts increasing, lap time is logged. Technically will be one timeStep beyond minimum distance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LapTimer

        public LapTimer(PApplet parent,
                LFS lfs)
        Constructor for single instance of LapTimer
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent Applet reference, "this"
        lfs - Reference to single instance of LFS class, i.e., lfs

    • Method Detail

      • lapTimerAndCountReset

        public void lapTimerAndCountReset()
        Reset stop watch timer, and clear lapList

      • getTick

        public int getTick()
        Get current timer tick, not available if contest is running.
        Returns:
        timerTick in time steps taken

      • setTick

        public void setTick(int tick)
        Get current timer tick, not available if contest is running.
        Parameters:
        current - timer tick, time in time steps taken

      • ticksToTimeStr

        public java.lang.String ticksToTimeStr(int t)
        Given number of timer ticks, convert to formatted time mn:se.millis e.g. 1:02.345
        Parameters:
        t - number of ticks to be multiplied by timeStep to arrive at elapsed time.
        Returns:
        String formatted mn:se.millisec

      • getTimeStr

        public java.lang.String getTimeStr()
        Return time string for current time logged on stopwatch (total time elapsed)
        Returns:
        time string formatted mn:se.millis

      • drawPanel

        public void drawPanel(java.lang.String title,
                      int nvis,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int w,
                      int h)
        Draw panel containing lap times or lap times and start of lap
        Parameters:
        title - Title string to be placed top center of panel
        nvis - Number of visible lines (depends on h) up to user to calibrate
        x - X offset of panel from screen upper-left corner (pixels)
        y - Y offset of panel
        w - panel width
        h - panel height

      • lapTimerEnable

        public void lapTimerEnable(boolean lapMode)
        Enable lap timer with option to run in lap timer mode or regular timer mode.
        Parameters:
        lapMode - if true run in lap timer mode, false normal timer

      • lapTimerUpdate

        public boolean lapTimerUpdate(boolean simRequestStep)
        Call every draw time,
        Parameters:
        simRequestStep - set true if simulation is taking timestep, timer will increment one tick.
        Returns:
        Returns true if lap detected and logged
